text:
<human>: What network contacts do the Alumni have?
<bot>: The Alumni are linked in an active network, organizing many different initiatives, and they are a precious resource for the SDA Bocconi as promoters and interviewers in various countries. To find out more, visit alumni page: https://www.bocconialumni.it

<human>: How can I contact an MBA Alumni to get direct information?
<bot>: The Alumni are very willing to speak openly about their experience and you can meet them in forums and infosessions.
Check the Program events website out: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/program-events

<human>: How many SDA Bocconi Alumni are there?
<bot>: There are more than 9,000 MBA and Master Alumni worldwide. The Alumni are one of the greatest assets of business schools and being part of the Alumni network is one of the life-long benefits of joining an MBA Program.
The community of SDA Bocconi MBA Alumni is widespread, and is now connected on the global level through Bocconi Alumni Association which brings together all University, MBA and Master Alumni.

<human>: Does SDA Bocconi provide on-campus accommodation?
<bot>: SDA Bocconi does not provide on-campus accommodation. But there is a good variety of reasonably priced housing in the area: apartment, hotel or residence.
The usual solution is to rent a room or an apartment in the area. There is an external consultant as well, who'll help you find accommodation in a very short time.
If you prefer a residence or a hotel, there are various possibilities, some of which are within easy reach of the school and offer special rates for Bocconi students.

<human>: Are there other sources of information when house-hunting?
<bot>: We suggest you take a look at the notice boards of Università Bocconi and of the other universities in Milan (Università Statale, Politecnico and Università Cattolica).
Other good sources of information are Easy Milano (a magazine available in many bars), Secondamano and PiùCase (newspapers issued daily from Monday to Friday and available at all news-stands), as well as the Internet Affitti.
You need to be quick in making your phone calls as available apartments disappear fast, especially in September

For information and bookings call
+39.0871.803614
199.199.650.

<human>: What are the available facilities?
<bot>: In short: Bocconi Library, gym, bookstore, several cafeterias and restaurants inside and outside Bocconi University, language laboratory.
Masters participants can count on the resources and facilities of Bocconi Library, which has over 700,000 volumes and more than 6,500 periodical titles and is one of the largest specialised business and management libraries in the world.
The facilities also include a Language Centre, where a number of languages can be practiced from beginner to advanced level. Among these: English, French, German, Spanish, Russian, Japanese, Chinese, Arabic and Italian.

<human>: Does the School offer language courses?
<bot>: The School does offer language courses, but these are usually not part of a Master program.
So, it's up to you to decide whether or not to attend these courses.

<human>: Where is SDA Bocconi, and how to get there?
<bot>: SDA Bocconi School of Management is at 10 Via Sarfatti in Milano.
Find more information on how to reach SDA Bocconi here: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/how-to-reach-us

<human>: What is the GMAT test?
<bot>: The Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) test is a computer-adaptive test that is available year-round at test centres throughout the world.
This test measures basic, mathematical, and analytical writing skills.
It is specifically designed to help Business Schools to assess the qualifications of applicants for advanced study in business and management. The test yields four scores (verbal, quantitative, total and analytical writing assessments) in order to measure applicants' potential academic performance in graduate management education.
Each of these scores is reported on a fixed scale.
A good preparation kit explains the strategies and techniques to solve the problems.

<human>: What if I take an alternative to the GMAT test?
<bot>: Some Masters selection criteria accept GRE as an alternative to GMAT.
We suggest you check on each Master’s website.

<human>: What is the TOEFL test?
<bot>: TOEFL certifies your proficiency in Academic English.
Since only some SDA Bocconi Masters require the TOEFL test, we suggest that you check on each Master’s website./nIn any case, if you are a native English speaker or you obtained a High School Diploma in English or you hold a degree from a University where courses are taught in English, you won't have to take the TOEFL test.
The School's TOEFL code is 0698.
The test is used and admitted all over the world, and consists of four parts: listening, reading, writing, and speaking.
More information and preparation kits can be found at the official TOEFL website.

<human>: Do you offer scholarships or tuition waivers to Master students?
<bot>: Some master programs have scholarships or tuition weavers. They can be offered by the School, by companies or institutions and can cover tuition fees both fully and partially. Requisites vary according to the sponsors.
More information available on each Master’s website.

<human>: In what language is the MBA held?
<bot>: The program is entirely held in English.

<human>: What are the aims of the MBA Program?
<bot>: The SDA Bocconi MBA is a general management program. It is demanding and intense, and aims to produce a new breed of well-prepared and flexible managers.
The prime objective is to bring out existing individual qualities, make the most of potential and supply solid knowledge.
It offers an answer to companies looking for managers with wide-ranging and lasting skills, fully aware of the analytical and social dimensions of managerial issues.

<human>: What are the strong points of the SDA Bocconi MBA?
<bot>: The strength of the SDA Bocconi MBA lies in its special, all-embracing and rigorous approach, that offers you:
- A dynamic learning model: action-oriented, global, experiential, inductive, rigorous.
- A flexible process: student-centred, personalized, stimulating, challenging but sustainable.
- A unique environment: collaborative, fair, interactive, open, diverse.

<human>: What are the MBA teaching instruments used?
<bot>: The MBA is a multi-faceted experience, where nothing is left to chance. The MBA is not a cycle of lectures, but a mixture of classroom work, case discussions, group activities, workshops, business games and field projects.

<human>: What are the MBA evaluation criteria?
<bot>: Written exams, role-playing, individual and group projects and daily classroom work are the elements on which the individual evaluation process is based. Several factors are taken into consideration: level of knowledge, contribution to the group's learning curve, planning ability, leadership and initiative.

<human>: Will I be able to learn Italian?
<bot>: A free Italian language course is offered to non-Italian-speaking students from September until June.

<human>: Can credits be transferred for MBA?
<bot>: No. The nature of the learning process, and the structure of the program, means all MBA courses are obligatory.

<human>: What accreditations does the SDA Bocconi MBA have?
<bot>: The SDA Bocconi MBA is accredited by the most prestigious accrediting bodies:
AACSB - Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business
EQUIS - European Quality Improvement System
AMBA - Association of MBAs
ASFOR - Italian Association for Management Education Development
CSQ - Quality Management System Certification ISO 9001:2008

SDA Bocconi also has membership in:
EFMD - European Foundation for Management Development

<human>: Are extra-curricular activities offered?
<bot>: Yes. In addition to all Club initiatives organized by participants and Alumni, several other educational, cultural, leisure and team-building activities are planned each year. They include the SDA Bocconi MBA's Conference & Regatta, SDA Bocconi Ski Cup, as well as main international competitions.

<human>: How long does the MBA last and when does it start?
<bot>: The 1-year Full-Time MBA usually starts in September, with classes ending in November. The Commencement Day is in December.

<human>: Will I be able to attend an exchange program with another school?
<bot>: Yes. A limited number of select participants will be able to spend few months of their MBA abroad as part of the exchange program run with other top international business schools.
Outgoing students may be involved in the Exchange Program starting from August/September and ending in November/December. Selection for an exchange spot will be considered based on the logic of the choice and performance in the MBA.

<human>: How is the MBA structured?
<bot>: The 1-Year Full-Time MBA curriculum is structured in various phases. This is desgined to provide a gradual but intense program, to develop and bring out your knowledge, skills and business attitudes, while increasing your networking abilities and refining your personal management style.

<human>: What is the expected personal commitment?
<bot>: Total commitment. Attendance is obligatory five days a week, typically from 8:30 am to 1:30 pm for class activites, from 1:30 to 2:30 pm for lunch or lunch&learn seminars, 2:30 pm to 7:30 pm for seminars, club and career service activities. In general, you can expect five to six hours of classroom activity per day, plus group work and hours of study at home or with colleagues.

<human>: How should I complete the application for admission?
<bot>: You can complete the application online by filling out and submitting the online application and upload all required documents.
You can find more information here: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/mba-executive-mba/full-time-mba/admissions

<human>: Which degrees do you accept?
<bot>: Candidates must have a three or four year degree that is considered at the bachelor’s degree level in the country in which it was conferred.

<human>: Is military service considered work experience?
<bot>: This depends on what you did during military service. For example, human or economic resource management may count as work experience.

<human>: Do I have to come to the school for my interview?
<bot>: No. Our network of Alumni interviewers can interview candidates in their home country.

<human>: Will I have to take the TOEFL test?
<bot>: All candidates must demonstrate their level of knowledge of English by taking one of these tests: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE or CPE. The only exceptions are candidates whose mother tongue is English or those who took a degree in English. Here you find more information about test scores validity: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/mba-executive-mba/full-time-mba/admissions

<human>: Will I have to take the IELTS test?
<bot>: All candidates must demonstrate their level of knowledge of English by taking one of these tests: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE or CPE. The only exceptions are candidates whose mother tongue is English or those who took a degree in English. Here you find more information about test scores validity: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/mba-executive-mba/full-time-mba/admissions

<human>: Will I have to take the PTE test?
<bot>: All candidates must demonstrate their level of knowledge of English by taking one of these tests: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE or CPE. The only exceptions are candidates whose mother tongue is English or those who took a degree in English. Here you find more information about test scores validity: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/mba-executive-mba/full-time-mba/admissions

<human>: Will I have to take the CPE test?
<bot>: All candidates must demonstrate their level of knowledge of English by taking one of these tests: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE or CPE. The only exceptions are candidates whose mother tongue is English or those who took a degree in English. Here you find more information about test scores validity: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/mba-executive-mba/full-time-mba/admissions

<human>: Can I visit SDA Bocconi and talk in more detail with someone about the program?
<bot>: Absolutely and we strongly encourage you to visit the school. Just contact us and we will organize a meeting: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/ftmba/requestinfo

<human>: Can I sit in on a class?
<bot>: Yes. You just need to contact us: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/ftmba/requestinfo
This is a great opportunity, as a hands-on experience can be a key element to finalize your decision.

<human>: I cannot come to Milano for the MBA presentation. Is there an alternative?
<bot>: Yes. As well as presentations in the School, SDA Bocconi organizes info sessions and individual orientation meetings, and participates in forums around Italy and around the world.
Dates and locations: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/program-events?selProgram=mba.1

<human>: What is Career Service?
<bot>: Career Service is a dedicated team of professionals whose mission is to provide MBA candidates with the tools and knowledge to design a successful career development strategy, and to connect them with an international network of recruiters.

<human>: How can I access the online Career Service platform?
<bot>: Once you are officially enrolled in the MBA program you will receive a link and instructions to register to the online  career  platform, where you will be able to upload your profile and see all posted job opportunities.

<human>: How do I meet potential employers?
<bot>: Career Service organizes on campus presentations and networking events with companies interested in recruiting MBA candidates for summer Projects or permanent positions. Student clubs are also active in inviting executives, HR managers and alumni to workshops and round tables, and chances are you will be able discuss a case study with a company executive as part of your academic work.

<human>: Do employers recruit on-line?
<bot>: Employers usually post summer projects or permanent employment opportunities on the Career Service online platform, select candidates to interview from the applications uploaded by students or directly from the online CV database.

<human>: How do I create a realistic post MBA career plan?
<bot>: Each MBA candidate has his or her own unique experience, skill set and aspirations. At SDA Bocconi you will find many opportunities to discuss your career goals with coaches, mentors, alumni and experts, in order to create a solid career plan. Always with the support of the Career Service Team.

<human>: What are the Post-MBA employment statistics at SDA Bocconi?
<bot>: You can see all the information about post-MBA career on the Career Report: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/mba-executive-mba/full-time-mba/career

<human>: How does the Career Service support my career development goals?
<bot>: The Career Service team facilitates your professional development. They are your main source of contact with potential employers and provide a range of seminars and workshops designed to help you in your career planning and job search strategy.
They also coordinate an individual coaching program where industry experts help you create your personal brand and value proposition to successfully re-enter the job market.

<human>: Will I have to buy textbooks?
<bot>: The School will supply you with most of the materials, which are included in your tuition fee. Some texts may need to be purchased separately.

<human>: What is the cost of living in Milano?
<bot>: It is comparable to that of other major European cities. Based on information from recent students, you can expect personal expenses to average about EUR 1.700 per month.

<human>: What is the cost of the MBA Program?
<bot>: Costs include:
1) Admissions Process Fee: Euro 120
2) Tuition Fee: Euro 65.000 (Payable in four installments, the first on acceptance of your admission to the program).

<human>: Will a request for financing impact the analysis of my application?
<bot>: No. Admission to the MBA is independent of whether financing is needed or a scholarship is awarded.

<human>: Are scholarships available?
<bot>: Yes. Each year multiple MBA scholarships and tuition waivers are available for outstanding candidates, thanks to the ongoing support of companies, other organizations, as well as our Alumni and current students.

<human>: How can I apply for a scholarship?
<bot>: You should visit our Scholarships page and follow the instructions for the scholarships application. Here is the link: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/mba-executive-mba/full-time-mba/admissions

<human>: Can I request financing?
<bot>: Yes. Both Italian and non-Italian participants can obtain financing. More information are available here: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/mba-executive-mba/full-time-mba/admissions

<human>: What are the requirements for applying?
<bot>: You must have at least a bachelor’s degree (in any discipline). On average students in our MBA have 5.5 years of work experience, ranging between 3 and 10 years.

<human>: When will I be notified of an admission decision?
<bot>: The Admissions Service carries out a pre-selection upon receipt of the application on the basis of the documentation supplied and informs candidates whether they are suitable to proceed with the selection process. The selection process takes up to twelve weeks after all tests have been completed and documents received.
The outcome is communicated in writing to candidates.

<human>: What is the selection process based on?
<bot>: Admission to the Program depends on a rigorous selection process that takes into account several equally important factors. Your application for admission, academic background, professional experience, GMAT/GRE and TOEFL/IELTS/PTE/CPE results, letters of reference and interview are analysed scrupulously.

<human>: How can I apply to take the SDA test?
<bot>: Candidates may ask to take the SDA test instead of the GMAT. The test is run directly by the Admissions Service after the submission of the application for admission.

<human>: Which degrees do you accept?
<bot>: Candidates must have a three or four year degree that is considered at the bachelor’s degree level in the country in which it was conferred.

<human>: Is there a minimum required GMAT score?
<bot>: No. Although the GMAT is an important indicator of class performance, it is only one of the elements considered in the selection process.

<human>: I have taken the GMAT a number of times. Which result do you take into consideration?
<bot>: The best one. However, we advise you not to take the test several times but instead spend more time (at least two or three months) preparing for it so that your result will best reflect your true abilities.
For more information about test scores validity visit this website: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/mba-executive-mba/full-time-mba/admissions

<human>: When should I submit my application?
<bot>: MBA application review begins in September and ends in July each year. The MBA selection process is conducted on a rolling basis and, given the large volume of applications, we recommend that candidates submit their application as early as possible.

<human>: Can I apply again if my application is not accepted?
<bot>: Yes. The Admissions Service will evaluate your second application with reference to the first one.

<human>: What is the SDA test?
<bot>: It is a test in English, equivalent to the GMAT, administered directly by the SDA Bocconi Admissions Service.

<human>: I have a degree in a field different from economics, is this a problem?
<bot>: No, the MBA is open to graduates in any discipline. The optional online pre-courses are designed to enable all candidates to take an active part in the Program right from the beginning.

<human>: Is professional experience obligatory?
<bot>: On average, students in our MBA program have five years work experience, with the range between three and ten years. Younger candidates are eligible for admission if they have an excellent academic background, test scores, soft skills and motivation.

<human>: Is there an age limit for the MBA?
<bot>: No, though most participants are between 25 and 34 years of age, with an average age of 29/30.

<human>: Must work experience be in a company?
<bot>: This is typically the case, but it is not necessary. We recognize that the talents that each candidate possesses are both connected and unconnected to their professional position and the work they do.

<human>: What is the profile of SDA Bocconi MBA participants?
<bot>: Each year 100+ participants join the SDA Bocconi Full-Time MBA. They come from 30+ countries and have diverse academic and professional backgrounds. They share a mix of abilities and attitudes: intelligence and receptivity, involvement and enthusiasm, responsibility and drive, trust and caring in personal relationships, proactiveness and creativity, a taste for living and social and cultural respect.

<human>: Why SDA MBA?
<bot>: A program which goes beyond conventional managerial knowledge, and connects students with top-notch, inspirational leaders and iconic brands: from Google to Starbucks, from Prada to Illy. A program which offers students new perspective and ample opportunities through a bunch of activities like Leadership Series and Extra-curricular and Club Activities.
This is what your MBA is going to be like.

<human>: Why SDA EMBA?
<bot>: Would you like to broaden the perspectives of your professional growth? The Executive MBA (offered in Italian with some modules in English) is a unique opportunity to invest in your future without interfering with your present.

<human>: What is SDA GEMBA?
<bot>: The Rotman-SDA Bocconi Global Executive MBA (Master in Business Administration) is a modular program that combines the expertise and perspectives of a leading European and a leading North American business school in a transformative journey hosted in international business hubs.
A launching pad for future career phases and an integrated preparation for senior management roles, GEMBA provides a highly personalized focus on leadership development, and introduces participants to a global network of exceptional managers, faculty, executives and thought-leaders.

<human>: What is SDA MBA?
<bot>: An intense, international MBA in the heart of Milano, the hub of Italy's culture and innovation, and at SDA Bocconi, one of the highest-ranked schools of management in the world and a trailblazer in European business education.
It's a 1-year MBA, offering a total of 105 Credit Point Units (CPU), designed to flexibly meet the needs of students, with personal care and global exposure.

<human>: Where SDA EMBA takes place?
<bot>: You have the possibility to choose between a Modular and a Weekend format (and for the latter between the Milan and Rome locations) and the different combinations of weekend sessions with weekly periods of intensive training make these formats even more flexible, matching your specific needs, while always guaranteeing an outstanding learning process.

<human>: Which MBA programs SDA is offering?
<bot>: SDA Bocconi offers these programs:
1. Full-Time MBA. Learn more here: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/mba-executive-mba/full-time-mba
2. EMBA - Executive MBA. Learn more here: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/mba-executive-mba/executive-mba
3. GEMBA - The Rotman SDA Bocconi Global Executive MBA. Learn more here: https://www.sdabocconi.it/en/mba-executive-mba/global-executive-mba
